title: A true relation of a notorious cheater one Robert Bullock lately done in Oxford, to prevent the like. To the tune of, And for my offence I shall die, or, For the losse of my goods.
author: Shenton, Francis, attributed name.
notes: Signed at end: By one of Oxford = Francis Shenton.
With woodcut illustrations on pages [2] and [4].

Wood notes that the writer was 'Francis Shenton a drunken and broken apothecary living in the parish of S. Pet.-in-the-Baylie. This cheat was committed in Nov. 1663 & in the same month this ballad was published' -- Cf. Madan.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
